title: Is it possible to play VHS tapes on a laptop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure, if you buy an inexpensive USB “dongle” that will convert the composite video output of a VCR into a video signal your laptop can understand and play. People usually use these to digitize their VHS tapes for archiving, but there’s no reason you couldn’t just watch the tapes as well. Here’s an example, but check the user feedback and requirements to confirm that the software and hardware are correct for use with your laptop. Amazon.com: VHS to Digital Converter USB 2.0 Video Converter Audio Capture Card VHS Box VHS VCR TV to Digital Converter Support Win 2000/ Win 10/ Win 7/Win 8 /Win Xp/Win Vista Linux Mac/Android: Home Audio & Theater? Of course, you also need a working VHS player. These aren’t made any more, but are widely available used online, in thrift stores and pawn shops and local classifieds. VHS “HiFi” players would have potentially much better audio quality, assuming the tapes use that audio format. They’re also completely compatible with older linear mono and stereo audio tracks, so that type of machine would offer the highest audio quality. Similarly, a S-VHS machine would be able to play the higher resolution tapes that typical VHS players can’t, and is similarly compatible. Just make sure any machine you get is fully functional and has the remote.
